Come to pika for our Fancy Friday Feast!
Come see all of the awesome a cappella groups MIT has to offer in one awesome extravaganza of a concert!

Ever wondered about negative masses, the Dirac delta function, or just how your GPS works? Come learn about all this and more at New House, where our physics lovers will play with a magnetic linear accelerator and chat about Lagrangian Mechanics with you. Finish up your physics with an exciting surprise demo!
We have over 100 board games in our basement, from the original Siedler von Catan to Glory to Rome. Come play some of them. Meet us in Lobby 7 to take our van to ET.
Who likes art and wants a break from running around Boston?! And who likes spaghetti, too?! We'll be having pasta feed and mod podge collaging! Come meet the Tech Catholic Community (TCC)!

column4: Everything You want to Know About Computers
column6: What exactly happens when you power on your computer? Why does the internet even work? We'll answer all of your questions and then some!Sponsored by the Student Information Processing Board.

column5: Womens Independent Living Group (355 Massachusetts Ave)
column6: Sweet AND savory crepes are waiting to be eaten here at WILG! We've got a variety of delicious fillings (there can never be too much Nutella) that you can choose from to make your own unique dinner/dessert.

column4: Christian Life at MIT and Free dinner
column6: Experience how MIT students not only survive, but thrive as Christians in college. Come for an amazing night  a delicious dinner, worship led by our awesome band, student stories, and meeting a fun community who love God!Dinner served at 7pm, Program starts at 7:30pm.Sponsored by Cru

MIT Anime holds regular showings every Friday evening. See what our regular club activities are like! We will be watching four episodes of anime from 7:00PM to 9:00PM, after which we will have time for games and activities.
Come enjoy some grilled cheeseburgers and hotdogs at Sigma Nu.
Tesla coils, multirotors, electric go-karts, oh my! Like making things? Come to MITERS for our epic late-night build party.

column4: Kismat, MIT annual cultural show hosted by saas
column6: Come to Kismat, MIT's annual culture show hosted by SAAS (South Asian American Students)! Featuring bollywood, classical and fusion dancing and singing, this is an event you truly will not want to miss. Come watch our performers, who come from all over campus, and celebrate the awesome diversity of MIT! Free for prefrosh and parents.

Intrigue! Passion! Drama! Unabashed silliness! The MIT Shakespeare Ensemble performs, for your pleasure, theatrical scenes both classical and modern of incomparable quality and wit! Join us for a night of mischievous villainy, honorable-dangerous consequences, and infinite jest!

Come to Conner 2 to release all that pent-up energy by punching, kicking, and slamming cardboard boxes around! And if you get tired of destroying things, then just walk three steps over to where we'll be making our very own ice cream sandwiches! Cookies, sprinkles, chocolate chips, and more will all be provided :D

Eat, drink, and watch bizarre, thought-provoking feminist art films with MIT's anti-sexist student group.What does it mean?! We don't know, but high heels made of meat must give terrible arch support. Selection will be tailored to the audience.
Come enjoy a traditional Shabbat dinner - complete with the MIT addition to the Birkat Hamazon - and find out about the different Jewish, Hebrew, and Israel-related student groups on campus.

Brothers have been honing their cooking skills for months during daily dinners in preparation for tonight's savory competition. Watch them duel for the culinary crown and devour a dinner to astound the senses. 3rd stop on Boston Saferide East.

7pm Q and A 'Music at MIT' session with Dr. Frederick Harris, Music Director of the MIT Wind and Festival Jazz Ensembles. 7:30 Concert. Music of Bach performed by clarinets and saxophones of the MIT Wind Ensemble. MIT Festival Jazz Ensemble performs music of Chick Corea, Ellington, Guillermo Klein, and student composers.

Watch the Red Sox play the Tampa Bay Rays on a projector screen at the Beta house. Get as close to Fenway without actually being there. Enjoy the Fenway experience: hotdogs, popcorn, and a good time. Meet on the steps of the student center or or take the fourth stop on Saferide Boston West to our house (Beta Theta Pi, 119 Bay State Rd.)
Wok and talk! Discuss math and philosophy with us over delicious Chinese food.
Come on down and get some of our delicious and mouth watering barbecue ribs, burgers, and other friend foods, prepared by the brothers of Zeta Psi.

Feeling that craving for dessert? Come satisfy your sweet tooth with signature Italian pastries from the North End, as well as fried ice cream, fried Oreos and other delicious snacks! Haven't eaten yet? No worries, there will be dinner as well.
Stop by our house for some great dinner and meet our brothers.

Don't miss this! Talk to Simmons residents about college life! We've chosen a variety of student panelists to answer your questions about the next four years. We're open to anything - so ask away (but don't ask Eli about the sink...). Prefrosh only!

Do you like philosophy? Or baking cookies? Or jeopardy? Or even just fun? Get to meet the Concourse students while also playing a trivia game, making cookies, and discovering the meaning of life. Mainly, there will be chatting. Super fun times!

MIT Recreational Sports is hosting the first Inner Tube Water Polo Tournament on Friday April 12th from 7:30-10:30pm. Teams must have 9 players in the water at a time. Registration will be April 3-11th at mitrecsports.com. Sign up today!

column4: Mario Kart and Other Video Games, with Ice Cream
column6: We love playing Mario Kart... in somewhat different ways. Do you think you have what it takes to beat us racing upside down? Or are you an expert at racing with your hands tied behind your back? Come join the brothers of Theta Chi for a night of crazy kart, as well as other video games. Not into video games? We will have TUBS AND TUBS OF ICE CREAM!
MIT's Premier Improv Comedy Troupe presents a night of laughter, fun, and humor.
Enjoy a decadent night of chocolate strawberries, cakes and other delicious treats made by our pastry chef, Karen. Desserts accompanied by Karaoke, Pecha Kucha, and games.
Oreos, pudding, and gummy worms, oh my! Meet the committee! Learn about composting! Eat! Eco-scavenger hunt after.
Mingle with members of the MIT Muslim Students' Association while munching on tasty treats.
Come to pika and build your own personal LED lamp! We'll teach you everything you need to know and you get to keep what you make.

column5: Phi Delta Theta (97 Bay state Rd)
column6: Ready for your first night of party hopping? Come to Phi Delts to get some noms before you head out for the night. We'll make sure you're fueled up and ready to go - all night loooong.

column5: Womens Independent Living Group (355 Massachusetts Ave)
column6: Not ready to give up your artistic talents to the dark side (aka engineering)? Come get henna and paint your nails exciting colors with the women of WILG.
Like portals? Miss the Companion Cube? Come be test subjects in our newly designed test chamber. Don't worry, we won't murder you. We just want to feed you cake.

Get to know prefrosh through solving puzzles and playing Set! Join the Undergraduate Society for Women in Mathematics (USWIM) in eating mathy foods: pizza, pie, and donuts and coffee (topologically equivalent, anyone?)!

When Aida, princess of Nubia, gets enslaved by Egyptian captain Radames, true love blossoms despite the hate between their warring nations. Will they be able to find their happily ever after? Tickets are free, and you can get them at the door!

Interested in radio? Drop by the student center and participate in a live radio broadcast put on by the students of WMBR, MIT's campus radio station! Hang out, request music, win prizes, and learn how to be a radio DJ!
So, do you think you can dance? Bust a move with some Dance Central and win some cool prizes.
Melted chocolate and plenty of fruit and sweets to dip, what's not to like? Come check out the Boston skyline from our penthouse at our famous fondue night!
Come chill in our awesome Roofdeck with the Brothers and Sisters of No6. Our diverse and vastly international members shall provide great company.

LoL ' Dominion (Base, Intrigue, Seaside, Prosperity, Cornucopia) ' Settlers of Catan ' Apples to Apples ' Ticket to Ride ' Boggle ' For Sale ' Resistance ' Wits and Wagers ' Fairytale ' Bananagrams ' Catchphrase ' 3D Twister ' Anomia ' Rock Band ' Nintendo 64 (Pokemon Puzzle League, Pokemon Stadium, Tony Hawk's Pro Skater) ' Coach Ride to Devil's Castle!! Plus: FRESH FRUIT to nom on!
Hear from the Baker house team about student life at MIT and in Baker House. Get your questions answered and mingle with current Baker residents. Dessert and coffee will be served!

column4: Glow In the Dark Capture the Flag
column6: Rise up with friends and conquer foes as MIT's fields turn into a battleground for Theta Xi's Capture the Flag.

column4: Epic Dessert Meal Time at Zeta Psi
column6: We're gonna be making some of the wildest and most delicious desserts you could ever imagine! Stick around for crazy foods, smoothies, and games.
Algorithms! Data structures! Computational models! Come and enjoy delicious juice and learn some fascinating computer science.
Whether you're already a pro or you've never danced before, join us for lessons hosted by our very own brothers! We will be teaching hip-hop and salsa so you can show off to your friends back home!

Come and check out the livest party of CPW, thrown by the livest student groups at MIT. The Black Students' Union (BSU) and the National Society of Black Engineers (NSBE) will be playing the hottest hip-hop, rap, R&B, and dancehall for all of the prefrosh and students to get down to. Come to BLACKOUT and turn up!

column4: Board Games and Ice Cream Sandwiches
column6: Meet some of your new classmates through friendly competition! There will be games and more ice cream sandwiches than you've ever seen before. Play games and chat with your fellow MIT students. Meet us in our Dining Hall.

column4: Who Can Name a Bigger Number
column6: The ultimate test of skill and athleticism. Meet us in Lobby 7 to take our van to ET.

column4: Bouncy Ball Drop at Senior House
column6: Have you ever seen thousands of bouncy balls falling from the sky? No? We can fix that. The will be happening regardless of the weather!! Don't miss it!!

Come to an MIT Admissions bloggers meet and greet! See the folks behind the illustrated avatars as we emerge, blinking from behind our computer screens, into the wider world. Hear stories! Learn secrets! Become bloated with root beer floats! It will be SIMPLY SMASHING!

The three most important P's of your life are coming together at SigEp - Pool, Poker, and Pizza, all other P's fail in comparison. Come share in all the spoils. Maybe you'll even win yourself a nice prize.
It's a special edition EDIBLE Gummy Squid! Come see this spectacle.
The Boston Marathon is coming up. Kick off marathon weekend with Maseeh at the hottest party of the weekend. First 100 people to show up will receive Maseeh marathon swag!

Don your sunglasses. Sit down with the pros. Compete for prizes. A chip and a chair will be provided to all worthy contenders over the course of what will prove to be an exciting night. 3rd stop Saferide Boston East.
We will be going through the basics of what makes an awesome glow party. Two main topics covered _ intro to glow stick apparel, intro to care-free dancing. Neon clothing optional.
Geologist Randy Marsh predicts Mount Skullcano is going to erupt at 530 Beacon St at approximately 10pm on Friday, April 12th. Be there for the chaos, bring an umbrella.

column4: Delta Upsilon Presents Black Light Party
column6: Rage in our house located in the heart of Boston. Come in white and neon colors and get colored on with highlighters by the best of Boston.
Missed dinner? Come stuff your face with chocolate fondue and hang out with MIT's LGBTQ community!
Come sample some of Boston's finest delicacies! Enjoy cannolis, chocolates, and a fondue fountain. Either pre-game our Marathon Party, or stop by on your way out -- there'll be plenty of treats!

Want to party tonight? Or maybe just taking the night off until the REAL party at Nu Delta tomorrow? Either way, come meet and chill with the brothers of Nu Delta tonight at the house. There will be delicious chicken wings, good music, games, and more to go around.
Rain or shine, Phi Kappa Theta's Beach Party is open with a rockin' dance floor and the freshest tropical drinks. Get a ride from the PKT van, just call (317) PKT-RIDE.

column4: Oh Crap We cant Think of a name party
column6: Names are hard, but partying is easy.
Experience a sensory overload and dance the night away with a legendary party featuring DJ PHYLLIS.

Immerse yourself in the spacey-wacey wonderfulness of Firefly, Battlestar Galactica, and Doctor Who with the wicked awesome residents of MacGregor House. Food? Naturally. Follow signs from MacGregor Lobby.
Build a Dominion in Puerto Rico to prevent your Descent into Revolution. Through the ages, board games have been a leading tradition of Random Hall. Come play them with us!
22 lights, 22 IP addresses, at 22:22.
Within our hallowed halls, re-synthesize the primoridal dichotomy between man and society, the part and the whole, and so on through artistic discourse while partaking of our victuals.
Come for the pancakes, stay for the poker, Settlers of Catan, Citadel, Brawl, Apples to Apples-playing extravaganza. We propose we can fulfill your dining and gaming needs all night long.
Make mouthwatering mochi. Mmm! Meet me in Lobby 7 to take our van to ET.
Come and join us for an exciting night of making Manakeesh, a popular Near-Eastern flatbread meal. Be prepared for an evening of cultural celebration coordinated by Palestine @ MIT.
The Student Information Processing Board (SIPB) runs a lot of cool services for MIT, and we keep our secure hardware separate from the main office. Come get a tour of our machine room!
Make the most out of your night of party hopping at Theta Xi's blacklight smoothie bar. Let us serve you your favorite drinks while you chill and listen to some music played by our house DJ.
Sometimes when we say 'Queer' we're referring to our movie watching habits. Come to to the Rainbow lounge, check out our library, including our awesome book and movie collection.

column5: Sigma Alpha Epsilon (165 Bay State Rd)
column6: Come make your own CUSTOM french fries and ice cream experience while chillin' to some mellow tunes at the SAE House. We'll have tons of POTATOES for you to craft into the perfect fries with whatever seasonings and sauces you choose.
End the night with the Original Midnight Buffet! Featuring all of the fried food and snacks that you could want, foosball, billiards, ping pong and more.

It's a bird! It's a plane! No, it's an untargetable Medivac that attacks like a Mutalisk! Come play a mystery Starcraft 2 mod. Computers not necessary, but bring one if you have it. Meet us in Lobby 7 to take our van to ET.
Come play glow-in-the-dark frisbee with your fellow prefrosh!

You like deep fried things? So do we. Mountains of dino-nuggets, curly fries, taquitos, tater-tots, sweet potato fries, wings, bagel bites, and more await. Join our nightly tradition of Midnight Snack!
Come visit German House to gorge on breakfast food and play some Cards Against Humanity, Settlers of Catan, and MORE!
Ever wanted to be like Indiana Jones, but without all those evil Germans/Russians/Bishops? Uncover the ancient ruins hidden beneath the sands of East Campus!
Tired, but not ready to go to bed just yet? Come unwind in front of our TV after a long night of partying, with hot chocolate, and snacks.
Waffles and pancakes at midnight'absurd? We don't think so. Come hang out with New House 2 and experience the real start of a CPW day.
All partied out tonight? Looking for something to eat? Stop by Nu Delta on your way home to close the night with a refreshing treat.
It's never too late for an obscene amount of protein and sugar. Drop by Skullhouse for your last meal of the night, hot off the grill, icy cold from the blender.
Strawberries, bananas, nutella, ice cream, homemade whipped cream, berries, and more! We challenge you to make us run out of crepes!

column4: After Hours Takeout on the Roof
column6: The party isn't over just yet. Join us after hours for good music, video games, and plenty of takeout.

column4: Late Night Breakfast Burritos and Games
column6: After a long night of partying, join the brothers of DKE for a late night snack and relaxing. We will be serving breakfast burritos hot off the grill and playing video games, watching a movie, and just generally chillin'.
Hang out with coolest kids on campus, aka Technique, MIT's photography and design club.

Meet at the Rainbow Lounge to start the gayest of all scavenger hunts. Ready to run through the infinite in search of a gender neutral bathroom? How about discovering queer culture in east campus dorms?
Random House of Pancakes. Pancakes pancakes pancakes pancakes pancakes pancakes pancakes. Wow, pancakes is a really weird looking word.

column4: Super-Secret Gay Time (a.k.a. Let's Have a Kiki)
column6: Where the wild gays are - Wanted to check out the Rainbow lounge, but didn't make any of the events? Well, we were pretty stoked to meet you, so we're keeping the Rainbow lounge open ALL NIGHT! Everybody's welcome. Come make pancakes, hang out, and ask all the questions.
Looking for breakfast or a bedtime snack? Craving delicious smoothies and waffles? Not enough bacon in your diet? The friendly residents of New House will be serving up breakfast, so come get some!
Stayed up all night? Come fuel up for an exciting day the right way: with a scrumptious assortment of pancakes! Make them your own with rainbow-colored batter!

Kick your day off right with a custom breakfast made to order by our chef Karen. Eggs, pancakes, french toast, bacon strips, sausages and much more. Don't forget to try the ZBT Classic, a McZBT. Call Rick for Rides (617-232-3257). Remember to drop by daily for this event!
THE BREAKFAST will be served. Expect an exquisite breakfast that will have you satisfied all the way up to Nu Delta's Project ND party tonight.
Want to work off that free food? Still got some energy? Come bust a move with McCormick residents! Breakfast available starting at 9:30am.
Watch our Iron Chefs throw down as they dish out a meal of epic proportions. Ready to conquer mountains of fluffy pancakes and piles of crispy bacon? Prepare yourself for the breakfast of a lifetime.
Tired of your typical breakfast? Immerse yourself in the power of the sun with an orange-themed breakfast.
Like bacon? How 'bout Belgian waffles? If so, head over to Burton Conner for a delicious breakfast with all of the above. :D

A panel of current MIT parents will be on hand to share their insights and answer your questions. Sponsored by the MIT Parents Association. Coffee will be served just prior to the start of this session.

For general questions regarding our financial aid program, loans, student employment, and/or billing, please visit the Student Services Center in 11-120. Staff will also be available to answer individual questions about your financial aid application or award.
The center for all things CPW.
Come recharge your batteries with delicious dessert waffles at pika before heading back out into the wide world of CPW.
Do you want to Catch Them All? Have you harnessed the Heart of the Cards? Come watch the cartoons you loved while tucking in to breakfast foods from your childhood.
Departing on the hour from Wiesner Student Art Gallery.

column4: Freshman/Alumni Summer Internship Program Information Session
column6: Learn more about this seminar, which provides freshmen with career development training, the cultivation of professional skills, and the opportunity to gain professional experience with an MIT alumni mentor. This information session will include an overview of the program, a panel of former F/ASIP students, and a Q&A session.

The Admissions Interns invite admitted women and their families to join us for great food and better company. Guest speakers and current students will share their experiences as women of color at the Institute.
Phi Kappa Theta is bringing brunch to you. Join us on Kresge for an enormous brunch buffet including pancakes, eggs, sausages, cold drinks, and more. Stay a while as we play frisbee and cornhole.

column4: Pile of Pancakes and Other Brunch Greatness
column6: Piles of pancakes. Jugs of juice. Batches of bacon. Endless eggs.Copious cups of coffee. Stacks of sausage.You get the idea.Breakfast! Come enjoy a great breakfast! Sponsored by MIT Cru(mitcru.com), one of the Christian groups on campus. Belief in God notrequired. :D

Bring the 'rents and your buddies down for this LBGT Family and Friends Brunch. Take a tour of the Rainbow Lounge, grab some yummy homemade waffles, and learn all about LBGT events, community, and services at MIT. Students, faculty, staff, alumni, parents, families, and friends are encouraged to attend! If you think this includes you, or the topics (or waffles!) interest you, swing by: all friendly faces are welcome!
Cross Products, MIT's only Christian a cappella group, is hosting an open rehearsal! Whether you sing, like to praise God, or are interested in a cappella, come join us! There will be breakfast!

We'll be rolling a giant brightly colored ball around campus collecting signatures in support of Children's Miracle Network! Come sign our ball and show your support - each signature earns us a donation from our sponsors!

Join us in the ancient art of Suminagashi, a Japanese printmaking technique that holds firm to all of the marvelous tenets of fluid dynamics. Meet members of the MIT Student Art Gallery Curator Committee, peruse our installations, and conquer ghrelin.
Wake up, ye lazies, and come pile unhealthy things like candy and bacon on waffles and pancakes made by MacGregor residents.

column4: Deep Fried Liquid Nitrogen Ice Cream
column6: What happens when you subject ice cream to a 400K temperature gradient? Om Nom Nom!!! Pun not intended.

Find out more about how the Experimental Study Group (ESG) works by participating in 30-minute information sessions run by ESG staff and current ESG students. Sessions held on a first come, first served basis. Strongly recommended for anyone wishing to apply to ESG by June 14. Information session will be offered again during ESG's fall orientation.

column5: Womens Independent Living Group (355 Massachusetts Ave)
column6: Join us in making sushi (kimbap), dumplings, wontons, and other delicious Asian foods. Of course we'll be eating what we make, and will have a lot of extras to share! (Vegetarian options will be available too.)
Departing on the hour from Wiesner Student Art Gallery.

column4: Field Day and Nerf Gun War!!!
column6: Like the one in elementary school, but run by MIT kids instead of parent volunteers. Tug-of-War, three-legged races, a Nerf war, and more. Prizes available.
Come enjoy delicious Finale desserts and coffee with the lovely ladies of the Network of Sloan Undergraduate Women (NSUW)! Learn more about pursuing business interests at MIT over tasty treats.

MIT Recreational Sports welcomes you to our 4th Annual Spring Dodgeball Tournament! Teams may consist of 6-8 players (any variation of male/female combinations are accepted). Registration cut off is Friday, April 12th at 11:59pm. Please visithttp://mitrecsports.comfor rules, details and online registration.

Come network with the Executive members of the Interfraternity Council (IFC) and the men of MIT's Greek Community, ask any questions you may have on a more informal and friendly environment, and get to know why being Greek at MIT is an immensely enriching experience. Finger food will be provided!

column4: BBQ on the Roof of LCA
column5: Lambda Chi Alpha (99 Bay State Rd)
column6: Join us on the roof of LCA, with spectacular views over Fenway Park, the Charles River and all of MIT. Burgers, hot dogs, chips, and drinks will be served. Then come watch the baseball team and lacrosse team play some in conference competitions.
Join the MIT Muslim community in a discussion about a contemporary topic (TBA).

column4: Breakfast, Global Virus Outbreaks. Cyberterrorism, Trading Sanctions
column6: What do these four things have in common? You can discuss them all (and eat one of them) with MIT Model United Nations. Come learn about our conference for High School students and what competing at college conferences are like.

column4: Pretzels and Pastries with French House
column6: The dough is ready! Your pretzel and pastry creations will be out of the oven in no time, just bring your creativity and appetite!
Have some down time? Simmons has an official velociraptor safety guarantee - but only because we train our prefrosh. Learn to walk through raptor terrain and take down some raptors (read: raptors).
Feeling old as you visit colleges? Relive your childhood with hopscotch, cloud watching, football, or frisbee. :)
Come eat brunch with the wrestling team and learn about wrestling at MIT. Meet outside in front of the Student Center (W20) and we'll walk to brunch together.
Come jam with MIT's oldest co-ed a cappella group in Lobby 10 and stay afterwards for some free food and a workshop! We love singing everything from R&B to pop-rock, and we even rap!

column4: Prehealth Panel & MIT AMSA Meet & Greet
column6: Come hear a panel of MIT prehealth students and alums share their experiences and advice. This is an excellent opportunity to ask questions and learn about the resources available for individuals interested in pursuing a career in healthcare. The panel will be followed by a chance to meet and mingle with current MIT students who are members of the MIT American Medical Students Association (AMSA). Light refreshments will be provided.
Chef John will be making another appearance in case you didn't get enough the first time around. Grab some food and then head out for some dodgeball.

Welcome to Maseeh's Majestic courtyard! Indulge in some BBQ, cotton candy, popcorn, and snow cones. Want to joust facing the Charles River? What about moon bouncing in a Castle? Come and join us for some Festival Fun!

Come play (almost) life-sized Settlers of Catan! Hoard (and eat, when it's not your turn) marshmallow sheep, pretzel wheat, oreo iron, and graham-cracker bricks! Trade them with your neighbors, or foil their plans and keep everything for yourself. Build roads, villages, and cities!
Bacon, bacon, and MORE BACON. Come meet the challenge of thousands of calories as you face off in this food competition!
Come enjoy some hamburgers, hot dogs, and ribs right off the grill!

column4: Spoon Making and Reuse Instrument Construction
column6: Meet nick. Nick made a yurt. Nick is carving spoons. It is a sight to behold. Meet robj. Robj will assist you in converting instruments of the laboratory variety into ones of the musical variety. Grilling and hair dyeing all day.
Join Spanish House for our traditional Hispanic BBQ. Learn about our cultural house and fill up with our delicious beef and rice and beans.

column4: Public Art Tour: What's That Calder Doing on My Campus?
column6: Get to know the List Visual Arts Center and MIT's incredible public art collection (those huge sculptures you'll see running from one end of campus to the other in pursuit of food and festivity). Take a pleasant outdoor stroll of the collection's greatest hits with a curator and ask about the artwork you'll be living with for the next four years.

column4: Sock Puppet Theater with the MIT Shakespeare Ensemble
column6: Ah, the majestic art of sock puppetry! Try your hand at crafting these glorious creatures, and stage scenes from such classics as Hamlet Prince of Socks and Sockbeth in our puppet theater! We promise fun and googly eyes.

Come join the men of MIT's Greek Community for an afternoon of carnival games, food, and music on the Kresge Lawn (across from main entrance of the Zesiger Center, W35). Sumo wrestle, dunk an IFC member in a water tank, or just chill on the grass. We can answer any questions about fraternities at MIT or life at MIT in general.
Stop by DKE for an authentic backyard wiffle ball game. We will be serving burgers, hot dogs, peanuts, and Cracker Jacks.
Find out why pika has the coolest house in Cambridge and marvel at our talking pantry, give our chickens some company, and more.
Departing on the hour from Wiesner Student Art Gallery.
African Peanut Soup! Strawberry Soup! All the soups! Grilled cheese too! Vegan options available! Meet us in Lobby 7 to take our van to ET.

column4: Bouncing, boxing, balling, grilling, singing, oh my!
column6: There will be music, grilling, and whatever we can get with $500. In the best courtyard on campus.
Come join us for Kiddush and a traditional Shabbat Lunch! RSVP tokosher@mit.eduby Thursday, April 11. Please bring your CPW meal card.

column4: Pickup Basketball on the MAC Court with PSK
column6: Whether you just want to shoot around or play full court, bring your game.
Because the only thing better than ice cream is MORE ice cream, smothered with your choices of ALL the toppings!!

Excited by LED's? High voltage? Electric vehicles?! Or quadrotors?!? Ever wanted to learn how to solder? Come see a showcase of student built projects at Burton Conner and build your own small LED project!
Like power tools? Come learn what MIT Habitat for Humanity is all about by joining us on the student center steps to help us build for one of our Boston-area affiliates!

MIT varsity athletes contribute significantly to the vibrancy of our community, bringing excellence to the field, the classroom, the pool, and the lab. Join us for a panel discussion of what it's like to be a varsity athlete at MIT, and the amazing opportunities available to student athletes here on campus. Refreshments to follow.
Departing on the hour from Wiesner Student Art Gallery.

column5: Between East Campus and Senior House
column6: Fight in the long-raging battle between East Campus and Senior Haus! Which side will you take?
A club fair with representatives from many of MIT's 400+ student groups, showcasing the many opportunities to participate in student-run activities at MIT.
Come enjoy some delicious burgers and hot dogs and hang out with the Brothers of Chi Phi on beautiful Commonwealth Avenue.
We've raided Haymarket so we've got tons of fruit and yogurt. Come show us your mad blending skills by designing your own concoction.
Come taste our awesome burgers prepared by our Venezuelan and Greek chefs! Great company is guaranteed.
No better way to wake up than with Colleen's famous waffles, fruits, and whipped cream.

column4: Lunch with the MSA (and Ultimate Frisbee!)
column6: Learn about MIT Muslim student life by joining members of the MIT Muslim Student Association out for a picnic and Ultimate Frisbee.
Come solve challenging logic puzzles based on topics ranging from math to sports to geography. First team to solve all of the puzzles wins! Meet us in Lobby 7 to take our van to ET.
An information session about TechCASH, which allows students to access their meal plans and free campus printing quota, as well as purchase food, meals, books, and more using their MIT ID Card.
Departing on the hour from Wiesner Student Art Gallery.

HACK the MaKey MaKey microcontroller kit, build joysticks and keyboards out of paper, play-do, or BANANAS. Play Mario and Pac-Man on GIANT projector screens using your inventions or get some DDR action using WATER buckets (it works, trust us). Going down @ Room 4-231
Come hang out with Club of Undergraduate Chinese Nationals! Xue di xue mei kan guo lai!

column4: MIT Asian Dance Team Open Rehearsal
column6: Interested in traditional or hip-hop Asian Dance? We're holding our regular rehearsals--feel free to drop by any time and join in, learn a few moves, and just have fun!

column4: Tire Swinging and BBQ at Senior Haus
column6: Learn from the masters of tire-swinging! This is no child's back-and-forth swing! This is an MIT student's rotation, precession, oscillation, and elation. Tons of food.
Build your own spectrometer! And keep it!
Tired of sitting in on classes? Come to the MAC court and see if you live up to the 5Ds of Dodgeball with the brothers of Phi Beta Epsilon.

column5: Burton Conner, Maseeh, New House, and Simmons
column6: Come meet Housemasters and learn more about MIT's residence life experience at these participating living groups: Burton Conner (W51, Housemaster Suite), Maseeh Hall (W1, Flowers Private Dining Room), New House (W70, Housemaster Suite), and Simmons Hall (W79, Room 265).

column4: Make Sense of it All with Maseeh Smoothies
column6: Need a minute to chill before another crazy night? Come enjoy smoothies and ask questions with the residents of Maseeh Hall!

column4: Hair Dyeing and Henna at pika!
column6: Come to pika with one hair color and leave with a brand new one! We're also doing henna artistry if you're so inclined.
Help defend the homestead from ruffians by forging a sword out of elemental foam and duct tape. Training session to follow.
Come build kites (and fly them if the weather cooperates) at pika!
Do you like music? Do you like people? Come join an a capella jam session with the MIT-Wellesley Toons as we make sweet music with our mouths!

column4: Spray the Courtyard with Colors at Senior Haus
column6: Go wild with spray paint on the courtyard!

column4: MIT ASME: Design like a MechE
column6: Come build, design, and play with some Legos provided by MIT American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME)! Unleash your inner mechanical engineer.

The MIT Shakespeare Ensemble will teach you how to look like a thoroughly badass thespian without actually hurting anyone in this beginner's unarmed stage combat class! Learn to fake punches, kicks, ducks, blocks, falls, and more!

Visit MIT Anime's Library, the largest private circulating library of anime DVDs in America. With over 2500 DVDs and over 2000 volumes of manga, it is truly a fan's paradise. We will also have light snacks, games and papercraft.

Medieval tournament with foam swords. Rules simple. Fence until 'ARHGHHGH'. Bloody, yes. Only finest warriors for Simmons. What do if time travel happen. Or chill and nom ice cream. All OK. GRRRAHHHHRGGG.

Learn all about MIT Dining, presented by Residential Life & Dining staff. This session includes information about the House Dining Meal Plan Program, retail dining venues, interactive cooking programs, and support for the cook-for-yourself community. (This event is also offered Thursday at 3:30pm in the Howard Dining Hall.)
Nothing beats a good burger on a Saturday afternoon, especially with good music and an epic view of the Charles River and Cambridge from high up Boston on the Nu Delta rooftop.
Do you hear the prefrosh sing, singing the song of punting men? Meet us in Lobby 7 to take our van to ET.

column4: Poker, Blackjack, and a Chocolate Fountain
column5: Phi Delta Theta (97 Bay State Rd)
column6: Come try your hand at poker and blackjack against the Brothers of Phi Delta Theta. Win great prizes and enjoy sweet desserts while you play! A perfect prelude to the famous Tropic Thunder Party.

column4: Mocha Moves Hip Hop Dance Workshop
column6: Come learn a fun hip hop routine from Mocha! We'd love to give you a taste of our unique flava and see YOUR hot moves.
Have you considered purple?

Come hang out at MIT's radio station, which broadcasts from the basement of Walker Memorial. Meet some members, play games, eat food, tour the station, and lear what it's like to host a radio show at MIT!

column4: Next Make: Build an Electric Piano! (Or other Musical Doodles)
column6: Had enough energy food to power a small piano? Want to learn how to solder and tune an instrument with a pencil? Come see why electricity is better than water even if voltage is kinda like pressure!
Come learn to fold beavers with OrigaMIT, MIT's origami club! There will be plenty of paper and books, so come fold something!
We'll have cookies, frosting, and sprinkles. Enough said.

Join us in an informal discussion about being out and coming out at MIT. Hear stories from current students, ask questions, get advice, or just hang out with some LGBTQ-identified future classmates! Best end to the gayest CPW ever!
Come eat edible board games! We'll have Oreo Checkers, Chocolate Chess, Banana-Grahams, Battleship Smoothies, and Settlers of Catan Pizza! (We'll play real board games too.)
Come learn to fold beavers with OrigaMIT, MIT's origami club! There will be plenty of paper and books, so come fold something!

Come hang out at MIT's radio station, which broadcasts from the basement of Walker Memorial. Meet some members, play games, eat food, tour the station, and lear what it's like to host a radio show at MIT!

column4: S3rd: Super Sultry Smoothies on Burton 3rd
column5: Burton Conner House, Burton 3, Floor Lounge
column6: Join the kind and caring folks of Burton 3rd for some delicious smoothies. Even if you aren't in the mood, come stop by and play some games as you get to know the inhabitants of Burton Conner's loudest and orangest floor. Awesomeness not required, but highly recommended. Seriously.
Enjoy a relaxing afternoon before your night of mayhem. Grab a juicy steak fresh off the grill and watch some sports on our 65-inch television.
Ever wonder what it's like to be a hamster? Come roll around in our giant zorb and find out! What's a zorb, you ask? Google it...you'll like what you see. ,)

column4: Dinner on the Sigma Chi Stoop
column6: Exploring Boston? Stop by for a quick bite at Sigma Chi before tonight's TOPGUN party.

Come grab some food and hang out with the brothers of Phi Beta Epsilon at the Kresge Pits before you head on over to the CPW Closing. We'll fill you in on all the details of the big construction project going on at MIT.
We'll be throwing balls at each other. Come to the MAC Courts at the Z for a good time.
This was a triumph,' you'll say. We'll be making our very own light-up LED Companion Cubes, and they'll be a huge success.

column4: How to Be a Millionaire: Entrepreneurs at MIT
column6: Come to Delts' house to hear firsthand the success stories of their MIT alumni! Listen to their secrets and tips on how they've made their careers. Both parents and admitted students are welcome! Dinner will be served afterward.

Whether you're a cannoli connoisseur or can't tell between a cannoli and a croccante, you don't want to miss this showdown between Mike's and Modern Pastry. We'll be bringing samples of this popular Italian-American dessert from the best pastry shops in the North End so you can make up your own mind.
The Student Information Processing Board (SIPB) runs a lot of cool services for MIT, and we keep our secure hardware separate from the main office. Come get a tour of our machine room!
Departing on the hour from Wiesner Student Art Gallery.
Come enjoy some of Boston's best barbeque! MIT students of color will be on hand to share their experiences about life at MIT.

Join the Association of Taiwanese Students for our annual BobaFest, where we give you the chance to shoot boba at our exec! Delicious milk tea and lots of boba (for eating and shooting) will be provided.

column5: Maseeh Hall, Flowers Private Dining Room
column6: Come meet the members of smart woman securities, learn what we are all about and enjoy some delicious fondue!
Sex sex sex, is how you say 666 in Scandinavia. Come join us in a traditional waffle-eating and board game extravaganza.
Come hang out with the Maseeh GRTs and floor reps! Travel to each floor to experience what each floor's culture is like, as well as participate in typical study break activities!
Make a sword, a spear, or anything else your weapon-happy heart desires. Meet us in Lobby 7 to take our van to ET.

Ever been woken up by swordsmen breaking down your door? Lost sleep while craving brie? Well, you'll rest easy after this event. Make armor worthy of the thirteenth century while sampling all the cheese Random has to offer!
Have you ever wanted to cast Global Thermonuclear War? Come play Random: the Gathering. It's Magic: the Gathering with a Random Hall theme!

column4: Sweet and Entropic: Desert and Tea at tEp
column6: Enjoy our pastries, caffeinated beverages and food for thought.
The residents of Bexley Hall will be cooking out together and invite guests to join us for a meal. Vegetarian options will be available. Please note: If it is raining, the event will not be held.

column4: Roofdeck Smoothies Round II at pika!
column6: Couldn't make it over on Thursday? No problem! The roofdeck is once again open for business and we have more delicious smoothies.

column4: Diplomacy is better done with Nerf guns
column6: Negotiations have broken down, and there is no way to settle things except through WAR. Join us as we fight until only one side remains.
Are you America's next big fashion designer? Come make an awesome outfit out of whatever we can find around campus!
Can you think on your feet? Put your procrastination skills to the test as you deliver a talk on a slideshow you're only just seeing for the first time. It's improvisation, academics style.

Come into Boston and taste some of Sigma Nu's all time favorites. Choose from a mix of Teriyaki House, Spike's Junkyard Dogs, smoothies from Boloco and cannoli from quintessential North End bakery, Mike's Pastries.

column5: Burton Conner House, Conner 5, Floor Lounge
column6: Roll up your sleeves, grab your whisks, and get ready for war _ cupcake style! Inspired by TLC's show, Cupcake Wars, you and your team will compete to make the most creative and scrumptious cupcakes that highlight our secret ingredients.

It's a geometric realization of your inner dreams and desires. Consume large quantities of structural burgers and sandwiches. We promise you a good time. You might only feel a little bad about yourself afterwards.

column4: MIT Korean Students Association presents: Korean BBQ!
column6: Hungry? Craving some delicious, satisfying Korean BBQ? Join the MIT Korean Students Association (KSA) for our annual CPW Korean Barbecue! Come chill with the KSA exec and general members, and dig in to some authentic Korean cuisine! All are welcome.

column4: Clubbing Baby Seals at Senior Haus
column6: We captured these adorable, 100% vegan, baby seals in dolphin-free nets. Now beat them until their sugary insides fall out! Do pi'atas the right way -- the Sport Death way!
Just woke up? Never went to bed? Seems good! Come get some french toast, bacon, and eggs! Vegan options available. Meet us in Lobby 7 to take our van to ET.
Join the MIT Chinese Students' Club, the oldest cultural club on campus, for a variety of delicious noodles. Hangout with us for this all-you-can-eat event and enjoy!
Chill with Delts and eat a steak dinner made by our super bro chef, Koga.
Come play a game of casual pick-up soccer with the brothers of Beta Theta Pi. Bring your friends and get in some exercise before you go back home.

column4: If You Can Dodge A Wrench...
column6: Think you've got what it takes? Come dodge, dip, duck, dive, and dodge your way to victory with our 5 time IM Champion Dodgeballers. Play for pride and glory on co-ed teams, we'll see who comes out on top. Meet at our house before heading out.

column4: CPW Closing Remarks and Variety Show
column6: Our last chance to bid you adieu before you head home. In addition, come watch various singers, dancers, and other MIT talent perform for you. We hope you have enjoyed your MIT experience! (To gain entry to this capacity event, prefrosh must show their CPW meal cards and family members must show their CPW nametags. Seating is first come, first served.)
Come join us on a scavenger hunt exploring the diverse and awesome floors of Burton Conner!

Palm trees and sandy beaches might be far away. So we're bringing the tropics to you. Come enjoy some Hawaiian BBQ and desserts with a fantastic view of the Charles River, complete with a hula-hoop and limbo contest.
StartLabs, a student entrepreneurial group, presents: World War Z. Come fend off brain-eating zombies on Brigg's field with foam swords and Nerf guns!
Roast marshmallows, sit around the fire, and get a chance to talk about life at MIT with the brothers of Skullhouse.

iLL ViBES is Chocolate City's open-mic night, showcasing some of Boston's best talent. Sing? Dance? Write? Play an instrument? All acts are welcome, even from prefrosh! Feel free to sign up on-the-spot to perform, or just simply enjoy the show!
We've got board games, card games, and tons more. Come play or eat delicious desserts!
Homemade laser security system, Nerf gun guards, what else could budding spies want? Meet us in Lobby 7 to take our van to ET.
99.9% of our house is off the meal plan, come learn from the best. Vegan, vegetarian, and meat options all provided. Come hungry, leave happy.
Learn about MIT Anime while watching a selection of our favorite series from the past year!
Come enjoy a home-cooked meal consisting of a whole roasted pig, wontons, and other Asian delights!

column5: Women's Independent Living Group (355 Massachusetts Ave)
column6: Come enjoy a special home-cooked meal (that's not hamburgers and hot dogs), prepared by the talented ladies of WILG! Vegetarian options will be available, and those with dietary restrictions can most likely be accommodated.

There are lots of parties going on tonight and we must be well fed for the battle fields. Drop by for our primal viking dinner to charge up for the night ahead. We hope you don't mind eating a turkey leg with your bare hands...
Grills fired, meat marinated -- all for you. We also have vegan/vegetarian options for those inclined, or if you're curious!

Not your ordinary BBQ. Come to the Beta house following an exhausting soccer match and enjoy authentic southern BBQ, including Memphis ribs and smoked beef brisket. Meet on the front steps of the Student Center or take the fourth stop on Saferide Boston West to our house (Beta Theta Pi, 119 Bay State Rd., Boston). Questions?: Call (513) 593-7126.
Prefrosh, tear down this wall!!!
Enjoy a delicious dinner with the Theta Xi brothers featuring New England lobster, clams, calamari and a fresh variety of other seafood. Vegetarian options will also be served.

Join us for a Simmons tradition. Chat with our residents and Housemasters while enjoying John's famous smoothies and Ellen's world-renowned pancakes. Seriously, you have never had a smoothie this good.
While you cook, while you eat, and into the night, enjoy the comicality of Parks and Recreation, Community, 30 Rock, and Modern Family with some cool MacGregorites. Follow signs from MacGregor Lobby.
Come eat our suspensions, foams and colloids! Science vs. Plain ol' good food - which wins?
Stab your friends and enemies alike with foam swords on Random's roofdeck! Champions (and everybody else) will then get to fry all kinds of delicious foods in our two deep fryers.

Tomatoes and dancing. Make salsa and then dance. Seems only logical. Eat some chips and salsa, and learn how to dance salsa with your friends/enemies/etc. Get your dance moves ready for tonight's party!

Ever wondered what a deep fried oreo tastes like? Fancy a deep fried banana? Lather up your favorite foods in batter and throw them in the fryer while enjoying a chill night filled with games and hanging out. Call Rick for Rides (617-232-3257).
Join us in the Maseeh Courtyard to toast some delicious marshmallows, make fabulous s'mores and listen to awesome music!
Engage in fast-paced rubber-dart gun combat with your friends, enemies, and total strangers! Team up or take on the world alone!
We like games. You like games. Come play games! Board games, card games, TextTwist. All of them are games. We have them. Milkshakes, smoothies, and cookies are not games. We have them anyway.

When Aida, princess of Nubia, gets enslaved by Egyptian captain Radames, true love blossoms despite the hate between their warring nations. Will they be able to find their happily ever after? Tickets are free, and you can get them at the door!
We've got Apples to Apples, Bananagrams, Taboo, Pictionary Man, Pandemic and lots more.
Come hang out! MIT's Student Information Processing Board wants to get to know all of you prefrosh. We're on the fifth floor of the Student Center, and we have food!
The MIT Live Music Connection presents its annual CPW Battle of the Bands. Come watch as MIT's greatest student bands duke it out! Who will reign supreme? You decide!
Want to empirically test the Scoville Scale? How much capsaicin is in a Haba'ero? Try some delicious spicy food and scorch your esophagus with the friendly folk of the Haus.

Have you always been curious about what it feels like being behind the turntables, in control of the party, as everyone around dances like crazy to the music you're playing? Come to our pre-party event to learn the basics of DJing from the EDM master himself, our beloved DJ HAL. Work with all kinds of music ranging from deep house to rave, from moombahton to eurotrash!
Ready to unleash your rebellious side? We've got the spray paint, you bring the skills. Come tag our walls as our party music starts to pump. 3rd stop on Saferide Boston East.

Put your Hold 'em skills to the test against the founders of MIT's PokerBots Competition. Those with the skill will leave as richer men and women. Call (317) PKT-RIDE for transportation. Of course, food & drinks are provided.

What's better matched than swing dancing lessons and spicy wings? We'll teach you the basics of swing and of eating wings, and you'll soon be a pro at both! Come meet the Cru community and have some fun!Sponsored by MIT Cru, one of the Christian groups on campus. Belief in God not required. :D

column4: Shirt Making for the Tropic Thunder Party
column5: Phi Delta Theta (97 Bay State Rd)
column6: Come to Phi Delts early to make some t-shirts so you're properly attired for the Tropic Thunder Party.
Come enjoy various board games with the members of Campus HOPE. Food will be provided! Don't miss out!
Make your own bubble tea! Or make your own ice cream sundae! Or play some Wii, Xbox, PS3, or good ol' fashioned N64!

column4: J.P. Licks Ice Cream with MIT Hillel
column6: Come join us for ice cream at J.P. Licks, the best ice cream in Boston, while schmoozing with current students and prefrosh. Leaving at 9PM from W11 to J.P. Licks' new home on Boylston St.
Stop by our Roof Deck party for live music, and a great view of the Cambridge skyline and the Charles River.
Spinning: performance art taken to a new level. Instruction on using hoops, contact staves, and more --- at all skill levels --- provided!
Whether you're here to sing along or just take over the world, come join us as we act out Dr. Horrible's Sing-Along Blog live! There will be love, drama, and freeze rays galore!
It's time for dreams. Find out what you can be in the magical purple nerd castle.
Come chill with the ladies of McCormick and get ready for an evening of partying! Paint your nails, find a party group, or just come to chat.
Come participate in an iterated prisoner's dilemma, bid in a dollar bill auction, and choose which envelope to take in a game theorist's dream come true. Meet us in Lobby 7 to take our van to ET.
THIS. IS. IT. The mother of all parties. Come to 460 Beacon to see how the brothers of Nu Delta get down!

Is it Neon? Is it a Jungle? You decide. Things will flash and glow, and you'll be taken through a magical land of color and animalistic desires. Dress in neon or in jungly type attire, and party all night long at SigEp!

Stay up all night with us celebrating the creepiest, freakiest, scariest, and most horrifying episodes of Doctor Who!, Blink, The Empty Child, Midnight, The Impossible Planet, and many more (including anything you care to suggest!). Plus snacks, drinks and conversation.

column4: Phi Delta Theta presents: The Tropic Thunder Party
column5: Phi Delta Theta (97 Bay State Rd)
column6: Come get wild at Phi Delta Theta! We'll have all the energy drinks you'll need to quench your thirst and the famous DJ Cruz will be dropping the beats all night long!

Blacklights and highlighters make for a night so wild it should be illegal. Tremble as our ground-shaking beats rock Boston. For the true MIT experience, you'll have to venture away from campus. 3rd stop on Saferide Boston East.
Come play poker and other games at the Delts house! Prizes will be given out to the winners at the end of the night!
Come party with the flight aces of Sigma Chi at our annual CPW TOPGUN party! Maverick and Goose will be in attendance. FREE AVIATORS AT THE DOOR!

column4: Chi Phi Heaven and Hell Party
column6: Chi Phi is calling all Angels and Devils, DJ SeaBass will be throwing down the hottest beats all night at Chi Phi, so come party like it's your last night on Earth!

column4: Late Night Stimulation at Senior Haus
column6: The Senior Haus courtyard is beautiful at night -- come check it out! On an unrelated note: Caffeine is a stimulant found in coffee. Nicotine is another stimulant, found in cigarettes. A great stimulant is Coffee and Cigarettes,' a 2003 film of comic vignettes by Jim Jarmusch.
Play Super Smash Bros, eat some wings, and listen to Dubstep. Sounds like a great night.
The KhaoS Party has been one of the biggest and best parties at MIT. This year is sure to be no different. Come to Kappa Sigma and enjoy the premier party of the year.

column5: Lambda Chi Alpha (99 Bay State Rd)
column6: Dance the night away at LCA's HIGHLIGHTER party. Grab a t-shirt and highlighter at the door and see what MIT night life is all about.

column4: The Glow Party at Alpha Epsilon Pi
column5: Alpha Epsilon Pi (155 Bay State Rd)
column6: Take a wild journey into space with highlighters, black lights, laser lights, and a live DJ! Paint our friends, paint your friends, and paint your friends' friends. Join the brothers of AEPi in our beautiful Boston home. Let us highlight your CPW like no one else... 5th stop on Saferide Boston West!

column4: 10th Annual GLOW HARD OR GLOW HOME Party
column6: The 10th Annual Theta Chi Blacklight Party featuring our beloved eurotrash DJ HAL. Don't miss out on Boston's most famous annual blacklight party.

column5: Tau Epsilon Phi, 253 Commonwealth Ave., Boston
column6: Learn from the pros. Note: Bring your own air.
Never played League of Legends? Perfect! Have played before? Come coach your team to glory! Meet us in Lobby 7 to take our van to ET.
For a night of partying with the sickest beats on campus join us at the No6 Club for our glow in the dark and black light party.
Rave: An underground party in which electronic music is played, dancing occurs in a very free-form fashion. The dress of the partygoers is quite unrestrained. -- Urban Dictionary
Does your team have what it takes to create a gourmet meal in under one hour? The answer is yes, we're giving you the ingredients and the kitchen.
Unwind at the end of a long weekend of events with some hot cocoa and a view of Cambridgeport and the Boston skyline.

column5: Sigma Alpha Epsilon (165 Bay State Rd)
column6: Come make your own CUSTOM french fries and ice cream experience while chillin to some mellow tunes at the SAE House. We'll have tons of POTATOES for you to craft into the perfect fries with whatever seasonings and sauces you choose.

Everything you thought you knew about food will be turned upside-down when you hack your tastebuds with a miracle berry. Enter a world where tabasco sauce, vinegar, and limes will become your new best friends as you cap off your CPW experience with the brothers of Theta Xi.

They're eating her... and then they're going to eat me... OH MY GOD! Enjoy such classic dialogue as we suffer through some of the most hilariously bad movies ever made. Meet us in Lobby 7 to take our van to ET.
Sugar rush from all the desserts? Come play Ultimate Frisbee with the residents of Maseeh! We'll even provide you with cool glow-in-the-dark gear!
You can't miss one of CPW's largest events with over 200 free t-shirts! Come explore MIT's extensive underground passageways while evading your future classmates in the largest Capture the Flag game!
FIRE: Everything deep-fried you can possibly imagine. Nothing's off limits! Why Part I on Sunday? Because this is only the beginning of your MIT journey...
It's never too late for an obscene amount of protein and sugar. Drop by Skullhouse for your last meal of the night, hot off the grill, icy cold from the blender.
Partied out? Hungry? Stop by PiLam to refuel with zesty wings and delicious ice cream.
End your CPW experience the best way possible: fried food, pick-up basketball, billiards, and more. Wind down and relax _ it doesn't get much better than this.
Learn from the master. Meet us in Lobby 7 to take our van to ET.

column4: The Grand CPW Finale All-Nighter at TDC
column6: Nothing to do? Feeling a little tired? Hungry? We've got the best all-nighter resources at your disposal: food, energy drink, board games, and cool people!

column4: Chicken and Waffles at Sigma Chi
column6: Is it dinner? Is it breakfast? Come finish off your night in Boston at Sigma Chi with the best of both worlds.
Until next year, prefrosh. Draw enough rainbow pancakes here to last you till then.

column5: Student Center, La Sala de Puerto Rico
column6: Come say goodbye to your new friends in the Admissions Office! Prefrosh will complete a short survey to let us know what they thought of their weekend at MIT. (Prefrosh will complete their check-out by returning their meal cards.)
Looking for breakfast or a bedtime snack? Craving delicious smoothies and waffles? Not enough bacon in your diet? The friendly residents of New House will be serving up breakfast, so come get some!

Come celebrate your ultimate victory over CPW! Enjoy breakfast at the Haus! If you haven't made it over yet, come fill your mouth with the Haus' sweet nectars and savory solids, and get a tour of our wonderful murals! You may see mating pokemon, or mating squids, or maybe even things that aren't mating. Who knows?
Come let us feed you one last time before you head back home.
Come join the Tech Catholic Community for Sunday Mass! We have Mass three times every Sunday: 9:30 am, 1:00 pm, and 5:00 pm.

Looking to visit churches in Boston? Come for a light breakfast (bagels and juice), then we'll head out at 10:30 to visit various morning services at Park Street Church, Hope Fellowship, Reunion, and others. Sponsored by MIT Cru - mitcru.com.

Things which you'll learn to spin in Random Hall: poi and staff. Things that make your head spin in Random Hall: the prospect of a delicious Sunday brunch made from leftovers. Awake and hungry? We'll teach you, and we'll feed you.
You want breakfast/free swag? We want to get rid of everything. Win-win. :)
Come grab some breakfast at Hillel before you head home. Meet current students, ask questions about Jewish life on campus, and learn about various Hillel events throughout the year.

You didn't sleep last night? Great, you're doing CPW right! Drop by PiLam to refuel by nomming on some delicious baked dough tori. And yes, we have enough caffeine to keep you awake for the next week.
A night at Project ND calls for a rewarding breakfast. The brothers of Nu Delta welcome you, and wish you a safe journey back home with this delicious meal.
Enjoy some delicious crepes prepared by brothers. One last meal before we see you in the fall!

Join the Tech Catholic Community (TCC) for some delicious brunch following Mass! We will have: Doughnuts! Coffee! And other assorted treats! Yum! This occurs directly following the 9:30 am, 1:00 pm, and 5:00 pm Masses!

column5: Alpha Epsilon Pi (155 Bay State Rd)
column6: Join in on the brawl. Super Smash Bros. Brawl! Played on two 55+ inch TVs and served with a delicious brunch. Because who wakes up for breakfast anyway?
Stop by our house for a breakfast of champions.

Everyone is welcome at our traditional xifan (rice congee) Sunday brunch. Enjoy a warm and comforting bowl (or more!) of xifan with all the toppings you could ever desire, along with other tasty Taiwanese brunch dishes!
